verses.roman:
nija-premāsvāde mora haya ye āhlāda
tāhā ha'te koṭi-guṇa rādhā-premāsvāda

synonyms: nija—own; prema—love; āsvāde—in tasting; mora—My; haya—there is; ye—whatever; āhlāda—pleasure; tāhā ha'te—than that; koṭi-guṇa—ten million times greater; rādhā—of Śrīmatī Rādhārāṇī; prema-āsvāda—the tasting of love.
translation: "Whatever pleasure I get from tasting My love for Śrīmatī Rādhārāṇī, She tastes ten million times more than Me by Her love.
